greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of sides of integer triangles [A070080(n), A070081(n), A070082(n)], sorted by perimeter, sides lexicographically ordered.
comment: a(n)>1 iff there exists a smaller similar triangle [A070080(k), A070081(k), A070082(k)] with k<n and A070080(n)=A070080(k)*a(n), A070081(n)=A070081(k)*a(n) and A070082(n)=A070082(k)*a(n).
mathematica: maxPer = 22; maxSide = Floor[(maxPer - 1)/2]; order[{a_, b_, c_}] := (a + b + c)*maxPer^3 + a*maxPer^2 + b*maxPer + c; triangles = Reap[Do[If[a + b + c <= maxPer && c - b < a < c + b && b - a < c < b + a && c - a < b < c + a, Sow[{a, b, c}]], {a, 1, maxSide}, {b, a, maxSide}, {c, b, maxSide}]][[2, 1]]; GCD @@@ Sort[triangles, order[#1] < order[#2] &] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 27 2013 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 05 2002
